title: Thousands of emails have vanished from Inbox - can I get them back?
creator: wchaserblack
content: I recently discovered that the content -- text, images, attachments -- of all of the emails in my Thunderbird Inbox, going back several years, with the exception of those I have received since July 2, 2024, have vanished. The header fields remained -- "From", "Subject", etc. -- but the content pane for each email is a total blank. So I right-clicked on the Inbox folder, then "Properties", then "Repair Folder", and the result was that Thunderbird then deleted even the header fields of those thousands of emails from before July 2, 2024. So now, there's no trace of them, not even the header fields. Before July 2, 2024, there were more than 9,200 emails in the Inbox folder. Now (July 9, 2024) there are just over 100. Fortunately, none of the other folders seem to have been affected -- only the Inbox. So all the emails I transferred to those folders over more than 25 years are still there. Does anyone have a clue as to why Thunderbird would randomly delete almost everything in my Inbox, yet leave the contents of all the other folders intact (even the "Sent" folder)? Did Thunderbird do an automatic update on July 2, 2024 that may have caused this disaster? Is there any way I can get those emails back? I use a desktop PC running Windows 10. Thank you.
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/126.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Thunderbird hangs 99.9% of the time when quick filtering on Body, want to revert to previous version
creator: radarrab
content:
Others have had hangs and/or have asked to revert to the last version. There was a response that said something about that not being a straightforward process, but no details were given on how to do it.

Most times that these hangs happen are when I start a quick search and it has Body included in the criteria. I have to kill it or else it just sits there forever. It's fairly frequent, but I also still can't get used to this new design and can't remember where things are. I want to revert or find something else. I've been using Thunderbird since Eudora went away. I do have emails saved under Local, as well as Gmail IMAP email for several accounts.

My current version is 115.12.2 (32-bit) on a 64-bit Windows 10 Pro Dell laptop. Some years ago I'd tried to go to the 64-bit version but for some reason it would not show up as installable. That may have been a previous laptop. I have a new laptop that I need to finish setting up. It's similar to this one, so maybe it would be better to use the old version "fresh" instead of reverting on the same laptop. IF someone can provide detailed instructions.

title: Documentation how TB uses folders to store mail and treats unused folders
creator: stefan155
content:
My TB folder has a few GiBis now.

I am looking forward to loose some kilograms and found that there is a folder "mail/Mail" which contains "Local Folders", which make up 80% of the mess here ;-)

It also contains "smart mailboxes" and a lot of folders which seem to relate to "historical" mail providers of mine. All of these folders seem to be unused except local. Seems they were POP3 folders (except local).

Then there is a folder "mail/ImapMail" which contains my currently used accounts - and some "historical".

Questions: 1) Is there some documentation about this folder mystery? 2) How can I store/export the old mail in mail / ImapMap / local in a HUMAN READABLE and tool-independent form? is there some tool that does this? or at least an API I could call from Java etc? 3) Can I simply manually backup the old folders and remove them? What indexes have to be re-built and how?

thank you :-)
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0;product:thunderbird

title: Error pops up when trying to send a message on a existing email chain
creator: talliejano
content:
Good day,

I've tried searching for this very issue on the forums, but saw that there were none. Hopefully, this thread might help me and any others in the same situation.

One of my users started experiencing an issue where, whenever they try replying to certain email chains, the attached error message pops up, and it does not allow them to reply to the thread.

I tried troubleshooting with the user in my free time, and these were our findings:

- It starts happening after the thread is over 5 messages long. - They are the only one experiencing the issue out of all my other users. - We tried sending with and without attachments and changed some wording in the email to no avail. - We removed and played around with the people in the "CC" and "To" fields. - Thunderbird is up to date.

The only fix so far is to just start a new thread and continue communicating on there.

Would appreciate any assistance.
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:127.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/127.0;product:thunderbird

title: Small message screen area.
creator: faroller
content: Since the installation of the new version of Thunder Bird I have to keep scrolling in order to read my messages because over 50% of the screen area is taken up by tool bars and the general layout. In previous versions you could reduce the area of the message bar by pulling it up. Now you can't do that anymore, you can only make it bigger pulling it down. I would prefer to see just a few mending emails other than 15 or 20.(?) Why are all the messages marked as a "This is a draft message" whether they are new or old? I "x" it out, but if I come back to the message it pops back up. I don't need or want my old or new messages marked as draft messages. Why is the "From and to" message area so large? It takes up too much screen space. Why can't I decide how large or small I want the different areas of the layout? In the older versions you could make these adjustments. I have searched and tried to make these adjustments without any satisfaction. Right now I am stuck with only about 1/3 of my screen dedicated to the message.

title: Problema con inserimento Password principale.
creator: assistenzatreviso
content: Ciao, io ci provo nel caso qualche anima pia possa aiutarmi. Premetto che uso Thunderbird da moltissimi anni e non ho mai avuto problemi. Improvvisamente all'avvio mi chiede la password principale, cosa che non ha mai fatto. Mi istruisco nel web in merito a questa problematica e vedo che è un problema comune. Seguo diligentemente tutte le procedure consigliate e mi accorgo di una spunta su "password principale" che io non ho mai messo, non sapevo nemmeno esistesse. Fino a ieri il programma non chiedeva nulla e tutto funzionava. Ho provato anche a resettare tutte le password come consigliato nel forum ma quando entro nelle impostazioni, strumenti, strumenti di sviluppo per inserire la stringa non mi si apre nessuna consolle degli errori. Le ho provate tutte.....non so più che fare. Spero di trovare la giusta soluzione da qualche esperto. Vi ringrazio tanto anticipatamente.
metadata: ;category:protect-your-privacy;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/126.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Copying email folders/subfolders from Local to Gmail
creator: FBrill
content:
Hello! I'm hoping someone can help me figure out why, when I try to copy email folders from Local to Gmail using Thunderbird, only the first 1-2 subfolders are copying over. (I tried to upload a screen shot to illustrate, but keep getting an error message.)

My end goal is to have all email files residing in Gmail, NOT Local, so they're automatically saved and accessible via Gmail if ever needed (though I use & love Thunderbird for everyday viewing/responding/organizing!) I have a separate biz email that was set up this way at the start -- but for some reason my personal email files all ended up in Local and I can't figure out how to get everything 100% duplicated in Gmail so I can confidently delete the Local folders. Praying I won't have to do this manually for every subfolder!!

Any assistance would be greatly appreciated!
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/126.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Copying Emails Between Server Accounts - Encryption?
creator: ryan111
content:
I'm needing to transfer a fair amount of company email from POP accounts to Gmail for Business.

I understand the typical response is to add the gmail IMAP account to TB and copy the messages.

I've tested this feature and it works great. However I'm unsure of the exact mechanism used. Mainly, is this transportation between servers encrypted?

The gmail IMAP account is setup to use SSL/TLS, port 993 and authentication method is normal password.

Can someone confirm these emails will be protected in transit? Thank you in advance.
metadata: ;category:protect-your-privacy;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/126.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird;solver_id:6045512

title: cannot send emails from Thunderbird using .comcast.net accounts
creator: frodowinters
content: With all of my .comcast email accounts , when I attempt to send an email I get an "An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: resomta-c2p-539727.sys.comcast.net resomta-c2p-539727.sys.comcast.net Excessive failed authentication, ESMTP server temporarily not available." Many attempts to correct with comcast. They told me to click network, choose mode of connection in the connection services list, click details, select TCP/IP and renew DHCP lease. That is beyond my abilities, even though I attempted to follow directions thru Thunderbird, I get nowhere! Help!

title: Version 115 Slow, slow and confusing on Windows 10

content:

And when I am reading a message and want to look in my inbox, I can't go there directly but have click on Contacts first.

title: login fail as of 7/9/24; password issue; I am confused
creator: nwoodard70
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for over 20 years, both at my former job and personally. I have never had a failed login. I have read lots of the forum questions for failed logins. I have tried following instructions in "Did your ability to receive mail suddenly stop? Was it working before?" I had to use my employee account (I am retired) to receive the code to sign in to this site. My personal Thunderbird account is nanwoo@comcast.net, but since I can't login to that account, I couldn't receive the code there. When I closed and and reopened Thunderbird, the whole imap://imap.comcast.net account disappeared. It now has reappeared, but I don't know if I need to change my password to my new Comcast password (they made me do it). If so, how do I do that? Right now, the password is the one I've been using on my Thunderbird account.

I am old and confused. I am not a programmer. This is very stressful and time consuming. You can't email me when someone answers this question, because I can't login to my email!

I will leave this window open until I get an answer.

title: Thunderbird 115 Mail Group
creator: atm.email
content: When a mail group is created and a recipient has an alternate (non-default) email address which is used for purposes of the list, once the list is saved, the entry for the recipient changes to the default address rather than the chosen alternate address. For example, if an individual has both a home and work address with the work address as the default, how can a list which needs the home address be forced to retain the home address rather than reverting to the default work address when the list is saved?

title: Emails
creator: runningwild900
content:
I have 3 email accounts on Thunderbird, on my main email account I cannot send emails, I receive just fine. I get the following message when sending. I've checked my settings and don't see anything wrong; I've done no new updates that I know of, had account for years. Thanks

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: <runningwild900@roadrunner.com> sender rejected. The email address you are sending as must match the email address you used to auth. Please check your SMTP settings. AUP#Out-1500. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again
